analysis.functional_summary: The module defines a data structure for customer records, including fields for identification, personal information, and credit score details. It uses COBOL data definitions to specify the layout and types of each field.
data_flow: Step 1: Data is structured into fields such as COMM-EYECATCHER, COMM-KEY, COMM-NAME, etc.
Step 2: COMM-DATE-OF-BIRTH and COMM-CS-REVIEW-DATE are redefined into sub-fields for day, month, and year.
Step 3: Data is prepared for use in other parts of the system, potentially for storage or processing.
modernization_notes: Consider refactoring the data structure to use modern data types and structures.
Evaluate the need for redefining fields and explore alternatives in modern languages.
Assess the potential for integrating with modern database systems or APIs.
analysis.analysis_notes: The code is primarily a data structure definition with no explicit logic or processing. It serves as a template for customer data, likely used in conjunction with other modules that perform operations on this data.
